intro: Lindernia cowiei, commonly known as the silverleaf lindernia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial that features silvery-gray foliage and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its ornamental value comes from its striking foliage and prolonged blooming period. Lindernia cowiei is also valued for its drought tolerance and ability to attract pollinators.
